definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Knowledge makes one laugh, but wealth makes onlne dance.
sentences.chinese: 知识使人笑逐颜开，财富使人手舞足蹈。

sentences.english: It’s no surprise that the Obama children beam with life.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到奥巴马的孩子面对生活笑逐颜开。

sentences.english: On the contrary, Singaporeans are seemed to be 'smiling away' to have her.
sentences.chinese: 相反新加坡人却因为从此拥有了她而“笑逐颜开”。

sentences.english: People around are beginning to beam with smiles.
sentences.chinese: 周围的人开始笑逐颜开。

sentences.english: I grinned as I finished with a strong sense of passion.
sentences.chinese: 带着满腔热忱，我完成了整套动作，笑逐颜开。

sentences.english: Things that make us smile, laugh and feel good are just awesome.
sentences.chinese: 所有让我们笑逐颜开，感觉不错的事都值得敬重。

sentences.english: A happy face with a big, big smile.
sentences.chinese: 一张笑逐颜开的快乐的脸。

sentences.english: Smiles is a good test it, test had no choice but to continue the bad.
sentences.chinese: 考好的呢就是笑逐颜开，考坏的只好再接再厉了。

definition: grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
